techniqueRules: Start with soffritto and cook until sweet.
Marry pasta and sauce with pasta water.
Season in layers and finish with acid or cheese.
substitutions: No passata -> crushed tomatoes + pinch of sugar

snippets.text: For Sunday comfort, simmer sauce low and let it rest before serving.
For weeknights, use short simmer and one-pan finishing for speed without losing depth.
Sicilian cues: sweet-sour balance, capers or anchovy optional, toasted breadcrumbs.
Neapolitan cues: tomato purity, garlic, basil, and fewer ingredients.
Italian-American New York cues: red-sauce generosity, meatball-friendly texture, family-size portions.
Kid-friendly Italian: softer acidity, mild herbs, no aggressive heat.
